Sample Vanilla Role:
You are a Vanilia Townie. You are part of the Town.

You have no night action

Town Win Condition: You win when all Anti-Town forces have been eliminated, and there is at least one town person alive.
-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+- -+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
Please confirm that you understand your role, alignment, and win condition by replying to this PM.
The thread is located here: Mafia Topic

Rules
1. Votes and unvotes must be in bold in order to be counted. Unvoting before casting a new vote is not necessary, but a good habit nonetheless. (e.g. Unvote, vote Bunnylover)
2. Lynches always require a majority of votes (I.E. This means 4 votes are required for a lynch when 6 people are still alive). After a lynch has been reached, votes or unvotes are no longer counted.
3. You may vote No Lynch. (e.g. Vote No Lynch) If a majority votes No Lynch, the day will end without a lynch.
4. If days take too long, the mod may impose a deadline. If no majority of votes has been reached by the deadline, whoever has most votes at that time will be lynched. In case of a tie or in case No Lynch has most votes, the day will end without a lynch.
5. After your death scene has been posted, you may no longer post. If you can't resist the urge, you may post exactly one very short post saying nothing more than "bah".
6. You're not allowed to quote personal messages from me. Communication with the mod is not to be used as part of the gameplay. Pretending to quote the mod is punishable too.
7. You're not allowed to edit your posts, unless that post is the last post in the topic. I will be comparing the time the post was last edited and the time the next post was made to check if this rule is being honoured.
8. Do not use fonts smaller than normal or in hard-to-read colours. Also, do not hide messages in the post subject or links in your post.
9. It's forbidden to discuss the game outside of the thread, unless specifically stated by your role.
10. If a situation arises where these rules are ambiguous or incomplete in any way, what the mod says will go. If you have any questions or comments, please PM the mod rather than posting it in the game thread.
11. Every 48 hours, I will be sending out a prod check if you haven't posted.

Hi, Imat. Read carefully.

1.) As I have explained before, wanting discussion is not counterproductive. But doing something while saying it is for discussion is counterproductive.

Think about it this way. If you are conducting a psychological experiment, you get a more sincere reaction – and thus a more significant result – if you do not tell the subject they are the subject of an experiment. And so when you say things like:

Imat, Post 65 wrote:Sparking discussion is a strong function of the simple vote, and discussion is the only means we have of defending ourselves (Except for PRs, obviously...). So, in the interest of discussion, Vote: chkflip.

Imat, Post 66 wrote:Vote: Parama… for discussion purposes.

… you are not actually doing anything that is particularly helpful. You aren’t going to get a very good "discussion" when the person you are voting for knows you are only voting for them "for discussion."

2.) I am not going to post more against Marble101 just because you ask me to. If I happen to have other reasons to vote for him, I will mention them. Currently, he is close to adding fencesitting to his repertoire, but I am not yet comfortable it is legitimate enough for me to confirm my vote over.

3.) Furthermore, accusing me of “scumskimming” is fairly silly. I have read each post carefully, often multiple times. Simply because I am choosing to focus on a few things at a time – as opposed to taking a scattershot approach of attacking multiple people at once and writing overly elaborate posts when a few sentences will do – it does not mean I am not paying attention.

The reason I am repeating the case on Marble101 is because it is quite clearly the scummiest thing in the game. Yes: I am voting him for largely one reason. And I do not think his "explanation" mitigates the fact that he suddenly wondered about multiple scum teams when somebody claimed scum. That is enough for me to push a Day One lynch at the moment.

Accusing you of skimming is accurate, as far as anybody can tell. You say you have reads and insights, yet every time anybody presses you for them you reply that it is simply none of their business. How can we follow your votes at all if everything you're using to make the votes is held firmly in your head.

And how is demanding votes for one person over and over again going to get any more discussion than I did? You voted, people started talking. You told everybody else to vote as you had, and nobody responded. So you did the same thing again. At least I was aiming for something pro-Town. You are hell-bent on a Marble wagon, at best a Null tell and at worst Scummy.

Please stop. The operative word here is please. I am asking you politely. It does not help the game at all.

Marble101: Right now, the correct strategy is to investigate whoever you want. To quickly explain, consider the alternative. Assuming you are Town, if you announce your plans, it allows for scum to create their most optimal counter-attack. This most often includes (i) deciding if your investigation is not a threat and thus not doing anything about, and thus using any scum powers for more efficient ends, or (ii) killing your investigation target from under you as Internet Stranger has alluded, or (iii) role-blocking you. And in theme games – which this game is not – there may also be other ways to screw with investigations.

Scum should, on the whole, have to worry about claimed Cops. By telling the world who you choose to investigate, the scum have to worry a good deal less because it effectively tells them what they need to do to work around it.

4.) Ah. Now that I’ve checked Bezukhov’s posts outside of this game, I can understand the votes on him. I agree he is probably avoiding this game.

A few notes:

1.)
Marble101, Post 740 wrote:IS it possible to have a mechanic or scum role that means that all lynched people are revealed to be scum? Then we would be in trouble.

No. In theory, somebody could create such a role if they wanted to be hunted down and killed by the players in the game. But since this is a Normal Game (as opposed to a Theme Game) which expressly forbids "False Role Reveals" (i.e. lying to the players), as explained on the Wiki, then we can safely say it is not the case here.

2.)
Marble101, Post 740 wrote:Possible sanity issues would make me believe I could be naive, but I don't think so.

This should also be impossible, given that this is a Mini Normal. Roles which are explicitly Non-Normal include "Non-Sane Cops."

Still, there are "Normal" ways to mess with Cop investigations, including Millers, Mafia Godfathers (and presumably investigation-immune SKs), and Mafia Framers. Again, this can all be found in the Wiki article.

3.) Also, I'm quite serious about mass-claiming. I would appreciate it if people voiced their opinions on the subject when they post. You don't have to vote yea/nay immediately if you would rather discuss something, but let's not just dawdle about it.
